answers.answer: If you are a gestational diabetic then there is a lot that needs to be done once baby is born, it won't make too much of a difference for you this late in your pregnancy but its important to know why babyay be measuring so big. Also if you're diabetic baby will need his/her sugars monitored for a while after birth.
Lala, if you have uncontrolled blood glucose, your baby can go hypoglycemic after the cord is clamped.
The only thing is that I have had a steady weight gain throughout my whole pregnancy as well and no sudden weight gains. So I don't feel as though I would have the gestational diabetes.
I have do it twice at my doctors. I did one around 20 weeks and I do another one at 30.
I know exactly what you mean, I did an hour & I passed now they made me get a 3 hour(which was super boring) hopefully I pass.
My first test wasn't until I was 28 weeks.

question: I'm 35 weeks 5 days and a week from today they are making me take my one hour glucose test again. I passed the first time with a 93 and the limit is 136 but they said my baby is measuring 3 weeks ahead (by ultrasound) and that's too big. Doesn't it seem kind of pointless for me to do the test so late in pregnancy now?
title: Glucose Test Again :(
